definition: prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Amen bro, your IPAD will be $1000 next year.
sentences.chinese: 阿门，兄弟，明年你的IPAD就要1000美元了。

sentences.english: In your name we pray, Amen.
By him, and in him, all the promises of God are yea and amen.
sentences.chinese: 由他和他的，所有的承诺上帝是高雅和阿门。

sentences.english: God, hope their pitiful boyfriends can't hear that.
sentences.chinese: 阿门，但愿大家的男朋友不要听见。

sentences.english: Amen is transliterated from Hebrew into both Greek and English.
sentences.chinese: 阿门是译音，从希伯来语到两台希腊语和英语。

sentences.english: Make me be the person You want me to be. Amen.
sentences.chinese: 请控制我的生活，变我为你所想，阿门。

sentences.english: My lord, forgive all these sinful sinners , amen.
sentences.chinese: 主啊，饶恕这些灾难深重的人吧，阿门。

sentences.english: May god grant you a happy life partner, amen.
sentences.chinese: 愿上帝赐予你一个幸福的终身伴侣，阿门。

definition: Holy Father/God the Father (in the Christian Trinity)
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
memorial tablet in a temple commemorating a deceased father
